required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Study of Utidelone Injection in Patients With Advanced Non-small Cell Lung Cancer（NSCLC）
clinical_study.official_title: Open, Multicenter, Monotherapy, Phase II Clinical Study of Utidelone Injection in Patients With Advanced Non-small Cell Lung Cancer After Failure or Intolerability to Second-line Standard Treatment

brief_summary.textblock: To assess the effectiveness and safety of utidelone injection in patients with advanced or metastatic NSCLC as a phase II trial

primary_outcome.description: Reflected by percentage of tumor size reduction or regression, assessed by imaging techniques and expressed as Objective Response Rate (ORR）ORR is defined as the proportion of patients with a best overall response of Complete Response (CR) or Partial Response (PR) according to RECIST. 1.1.

secondary_outcome.description: PFS is defined as the duration of time from first study treatment to disease progression or death from any cause as documented by the investigator
OS is defined as the duration of time from first study treatment until death from any cause.

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of treatment-emergent adverse events based the Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (CTCAE) version 4·03
secondary_outcome.description: Observe and record incidence of adverse events and severe adverse events associated with utidelone treatment, assessed by investigators according to CTCAE version 4·03

arm_group.description: Utidelone Injection: 30 mg/m2/day, IV on day 1-day 5 of each 21 day cycle, administered to enrolled patients with advanced NSCLC

intervention.description: utidelone monotherapy in patients with advanced NSCLC by utidelone

overall_official.affiliation: National Cancer Center/Cancer Hospital, Chinese Academy of Medical Sciences, Beijing, China

facility.name: Cancer Hospital, Chinese Academy of Medical Sciences
